original_sentence: # The Unhealthy Comments Corpus (UCC)   The Unhealthy Comments Corpus (UCC) is corpus of 44355 comments intended to assist in research on identifying subtle attributes which contribute to unhealthy conversations online.
original_annotated: # The <DATASET>Unhealthy Comments Corpus</DATASET> (<DATASET>UCC</DATASET>)   The <DATASET>Unhealthy Comments Corpus</DATASET> (<DATASET>UCC</DATASET>) is corpus of 44355 comments intended to assist in research on identifying subtle attributes which contribute to unhealthy conversations online.

original_sentence: For a detailed description of the annotation process, quality control procedures, summary statistics and baseline modelling results, see our [paper](https://arxiv.org/abs/2010.07410), to appear in the [Fourth Workshop on Online Abuse and Harms 2020](https://www.workshopononlineabuse.com/).

original_sentence: The UCC contributes further high quality data on  attributes  like  sarcasm,  hostility,  and  condescension, adding to existing datasets on these and related attributes, and provides (to the best of our knowledge) the first dataset of this scale with labels for dismissiveness,  unfair generalisations,  antagonistic behavior, and overall assessments of whether those comments fall within 'healthy' conversation.

original_sentence: We hope that this dataset  can contribute to research on how to understand, monitor and deal with unhealthy online interactions to promote healthier conversations online.  ## The data  The dataset is provided as three .csv files, `train.csv`, `test.csv`, and `val.csv`.

original_sentence: The raw comments were taken from the [comments](https://github.com/sfu-discourse-lab/SOCC#comments) corpus within the [SFU Opinion and Comments Corpus](https://github.com/sfu-discourse-lab/SOCC).   ## Baseline classification  We provide notebooks to replicate our baseline classification results on this dataset in `UnhealthyConversations.ipynb`.
